        Parameters:

        month - The month part of the date.
        day - The day part of the date.
        Returns:

        public static boolean isValidDate(int year,
                                  int month,
                                  int day,
                                  int hour,
                                  int minute,
                                  int second)
        Checks whether the given day, month, year, hour, minute and second combination is a valid date or not.
        Parameters:
        year - The year part of the date.
        month - The month part of the date.
        day - The day part of the date.
        hour - The hour part of the date.
        minute - The minute part of the date.
        second - The second part of the date.
        Returns:
        True if the given day, month, year, hour, minute and second combination is a valid date.

      • getValidCalendar

        public static java.util.Calendar getValidCalendar(int year,
                                                  int month,
                                                  int day)
        Validate the actual date of the given date elements and returns a calendar instance based on the given date elements. The time is forced to 00:00:00.
        Parameters:
        year - The year part of the date.
        month - The month part of the date.
        day - The day part of the date.
        Returns:
        A Calendar instance prefilled with the given date elements.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the given date elements does not represent a valid date.

      • getValidCalendar

        public static java.util.Calendar getValidCalendar(int year,
                                                  int month,
                                                  int day,
                                                  int hour,
                                                  int minute,
                                                  int second)
        Validate the actual date of the given date elements and returns a calendar instance based on the given date elements.
        Parameters:
        year - The year part of the date.
        month - The month part of the date.
        day - The day part of the date.
        hour - The hour part of the date.
        minute - The minute part of the date.
        second - The second part of the date.
        Returns:
        A Calendar instance prefilled with the given date elements.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the given date elements does not represent a valid date.

      • addYears

        public static void addYears(java.util.Calendar calendar,
                            int years)
        Add the given amount of years to the given calendar. The changes are reflected in the given calendar.
        Parameters:
        calendar - The calendar to add the given amount of years to.
        years - The amount of years to be added to the given calendar. Negative values are also allowed, it will just go back in time.

      • addMonths

      • sameTime

        public static boolean sameTime(java.util.Calendar one,
                               java.util.Calendar two)
        Returns true if the two given calendars are dated on the same time. The difference from one.equals(two) is that this method does not respect the time zone.
        Parameters:
        one - The one calendar.
        two - The other calendar.
        Returns:
        True if the two given calendars are dated on the same time.

      • elapsedYears

        public static int elapsedYears(java.util.Calendar before,
                               java.util.Calendar after)
        Retrieve the amount of elapsed years between the two given calendars.
        Parameters:
        before - The first calendar with expected date before the second calendar.
        after - The second calendar with expected date after the first calendar.
        Returns:
        The amount of elapsed years between the two given calendars.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the first calendar is dated after the second calendar.

      • elapsedTime

        public static int[] elapsedTime(java.util.Calendar before,
                                java.util.Calendar after)
        Calculate the total of elapsed time from years up to seconds between the two given calendars. It returns an int array with the elapsed years, months, days, hours, minutes and seconds respectively.
        Parameters:
        before - The first calendar with expected date before the second calendar.
        after - The second calendar with expected date after the first calendar.
        Returns:
        The elapsed time between the two given calendars in years, months, days, hours, minutes and seconds.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the first calendar is dated after the second calendar.

      • elapsed

        private static int elapsed(java.util.Calendar before,
                           java.util.Calendar after,
                           int field)
        Retrieve the amount of elapsed time between the two given calendars based on the given calendar field as definied in the Calendar constants, e.g. Calendar.MONTH.
        Parameters:
        before - The first calendar with expected date before the second calendar.
        after - The second calendar with expected date after the first calendar.
        field - The calendar field as definied in the Calendar constants.
        Returns:
        The amount of elapsed time between the two given calendars based on the given calendar field.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the first calendar is dated after the second calendar.

      • elapsedMillis

        private static long elapsedMillis(java.util.Calendar before,
                                  java.util.Calendar after,
                                  int factor)
        Retrieve the amount of elapsed milliseconds between the two given calendars and directly divide the outcome by the given factor. E.g.: if the division factor is 1, then you will get the elapsed milliseconds unchanged; if the division factor is 1000, then the elapsed milliseconds will be divided by 1000, resulting in the amount of elapsed seconds.
        Parameters:
        before - The first calendar with expected date before the second calendar.
        after - The second calendar with expected date after the first calendar.
        factor - The division factor which to divide the milliseconds with, expected to be at least 1.
        Returns:
        The amount of elapsed milliseconds between the two given calendars, divided by the given factor.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the first calendar is dated after the second calendar or if the division factor is less than 1.

      • checkBeforeAfter

        private static void checkBeforeAfter(java.util.Calendar before,
                                     java.util.Calendar after)
        Check if the first calendar is actually dated before the second calendar.
        Parameters:
        before - The first calendar with expected date before the second calendar.
        after - The second calendar with expected date after the first calendar.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the first calendar is dated after the second calendar.
